memberdef.argsstring: (const char *src_string, const char *src_lengths, float src_rating, float src_certainty, uinT8 src_permuter, const UNICHARSET &unicharset)
memberdef.name: WERD_CHOICE

detaileddescription.para: Constructor to build a WERD_CHOICE from the given string. The function assumes that src_string is not NULL.
Delete current blob_choices. Set the blob_choices to the given new list.

briefdescription.para: Make more space in unichar_id_ and fragment_lengths_ arrays.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes WERD_CHOICE - reserves length slots in unichar_ids_ and fragment_length_ arrays. Sets other values to default (blank) values.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *src_string, const char *src_lengths, float src_rating, float src_certainty, uinT8 src_permuter)
memberdef.name: init

detaileddescription.para: Helper function to build a WERD_CHOICE from the given string, fragment lengths, rating, certainty and permuter. The function assumes that src_string is not NULL. src_lengths argument could be NULL, in which case the unichars in src_string are assumed to all be of length 1.
Helper function to build a WERD_CHOICE from the given string, fragment lengths, rating, certainty and permuter.
The function assumes that src_string is not NULL. src_lengths argument could be NULL, in which case the unichars in src_string are assumed to all be of length 1.

briefdescription.para: Set the fields in this choice to be default (bad) values.

memberdef.argsstring: (UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, char fragment_length, float rating, float certainty)
memberdef.name: append_unichar_id_space_allocated

detaileddescription.para: This function assumes that there is enough space reserved in the WERD_CHOICE for adding another unichar. This is an efficient alternative to append_unichar_id().

memberdef.argsstring: (UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, char fragment_length, float rating, float certainty)
memberdef.name: append_unichar_id

detaileddescription.para: append_unichar_id
Make sure there is enough space in the word for the new unichar id and call append_unichar_id_space_allocated().

memberdef.argsstring: (UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, char fragment_length, float rating, float certainty, int index)
memberdef.name: set_unichar_id

detaileddescription.para: contains_unichar_id
Returns true if unichar_ids_ contain the given unichar_id, false otherwise.
remove_unichar_ids
Removes num unichar ids starting from index start from unichar_ids_ and updates length_ and fragment_lengths_ to reflect this change. Note: this function does not modify rating_ and certainty_.
has_rtl_unichar_id
Returns true if unichar_ids contain at least one "strongly" RTL unichar.
reverse_and_mirror_unichar_ids
Reverses and mirrors unichars in unichar_ids.
punct_stripped
Returns the half-open interval of unichar_id indices [start, end) which enclose the core portion of this word the part after stripping punctuation from the left and right.
string_and_lengths
Populates the given word_str with unichars from unichar_ids and and word_lengths_str with the corresponding unichar lengths.
Print WERD_CHOICE to stdout.
Cat a second word rating on the end of this current one. The ratings are added and the confidence is the min. If the permuters are NOT the same the permuter is set to COMPOUND_PERM
Allocate enough memory to hold a copy of source and copy over all the information from source to this WERD_CHOICE.
